intro: Pentacalia balsasana, commonly known as the Balsas pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands. It has hairy stems and leaves that are usually opposite in arrangement. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after species for botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
